page.title: 13THE CHINA CLAY INDUSTRY
page.content: This industry only affects the eastern side of our area.Here as the land rises into the granite mass of Hensbarrow,the sand tips dominate the scene.Once the traditional white pyramids would have been seen here but with the expansion of the industry since 1950 and as a result an increase of waste material,and an enviromental demand these have changed to the huge banks of sand which now extends over miles.These banks rise to 30 metres or more and attempts have been made to vegetate them with grasses,and lupins which thrive on the sand and make them yellow in the flowering season.Soay sheep have been used to crop the areas quite successfully.The hamlet of Scarcewater is not quite so happy with the encroaching white,sandy mounds with complaints being heard.
